intro: Fremontia napensis, commonly known as the Santa Cruz fremontia, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of central California. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and related plants. The plant produces showy, fragrant flowers that are typically pink to purple in color, blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in chaparral or coastal scrub habitats. Fremontia napensis is known for its ability to withstand drought conditions, making it well adapted to its native environment.
